fields.description:
h3. Summary

Dynamic content macros  does not render inline as it should - they are rendered as block.

 
h3. Steps to reproduce:
 * Create a page with a inline LaTeX Math Lite macro.
 * Save the page

h3.  Observed behavior

!Screen Shot 2017-04-06 at 4.25.42 PM.png!
h3.  Expected behaviour

!Screen Shot 2017-04-06 at 4.29.06 PM.png!
fields.summary: Inline dynamic macros no longer render inline
Exception encountered when exporting to AO XML
"Premature end of Content-Length delimited message body" Error during Space or Site Export
javax.net.ssl.SSLException: SSL peer shut down incorrectly During Site and Space Export
Drafts do not appear on the user's personal drafts with collaborative editing

fields.description:
Hi,

I often have emails that need to be sent.

These emails are documented in confluence.

These emails have recipients, subject, and a body.

Currently I use [an online mailto link generator 3rd party website|http://www.cha4mot.com/t_mailto.html], and insert it as an HTML link

The most pain comes when I need to edit this... I click the link which opens my mail client, I copy all the fields into the online mailto link generator then make my edits, regenerate the link and paste it back into confluence.

I found a gist with something that may work with the on-premise version of conflucence, [https://gist.github.com/segilbert/5968297/] but we're using the SAAS version (on demand)

I would like an option in the "insert link" dialog where we can build an entire email.
fields.summary: insert link should allow you to build an entire email for a mailto link.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-51627].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Recently, [Single Page App|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/latest-changes-in-confluence-cloud-875410618.html] is introduced. The page tree no longer showing on the sidebar.
!screenshot1.jpeg|thumbnail!

Unless, we go to *Page* column, then access a page.

h3. Suggested Solution
Please shows the Page Tree sidebar on Space view.

h3. Why this is important
* To reduce the time and effort
** If we leave the space, we will lose the page tree and then have to go through several clicks to get back to it - which we didn't have to do before. 

----
{panel:title=Original Request}
The page tree should be displayed at the left side right after entering the space. The dashboard overview also should be displayed because it contains important information for the space. The space navigator is not important.

After Confluence layout changed to Single Page App it's not possible to see the Page tree and the Dashboard overview at the same time, as long as they are in different tabs in the Space front page. Also, the page tree opens on the left side only when you're accessing a page.
{panel}
fields.summary: Display page tree and dashboard overview when you access a space

fields.description:
1) Create two spaces, ABC and DEF

2) Create a Page "Parent" on space ABC

3) Create a draft under "Parent" on space ABC but don't publish it

4) Move "Parent" to space DEF

5) Do a space export of space ABC, the export has both spaces ABC and DEF

This is because the draft page isn't moved with "Parent", it has a spaceId in space ABC but a parent that's in space DEF. This causes space exports from space ABC to be unusable.
fields.summary: Moving a Page to a new Space doesn't Move it's Unsaved Draft Children and breaks Space Export

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Unable to search Japanese characters in the content of Word file correctly.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence 1000.1172.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Word file which is as follows - [^TEST.docx]
{noformat}
あいうえお
{noformat}

 # Attach the Word file to a Confluence page
 # Search the Word file on Confluence

h3. Expected Results

We should be able to search the Word file with some keywords inside of the content.
h3. Actual Results

We can't search the Word file with the keywords correctly.
 If we try to search the Word file with the filename, the following result is shown as follows.

!word.png|thumbnail!

The characters "あいうえお" seems to be indexed as "あああああ". It might cause the problem.
h3. Notes

Even though we used the other indexing languages like "CJK" and "Custom Japanese", the problem happened.
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround at this time.
fields.summary: [Backend] Unable to search Japanese characters in the content of Word file correctly

fields.description:
Description

When the user tries to create multiple JIRA issues from a table in Confluence the issue is created in JIRA but is not added in the Confluence’s table. If the user creates the issues one by one they are created in JIRA and correctly added to the table in Confluence.

Steps to reproduce

  1. Create a project into JIRA
  2. Create a new page in Confluence and add a table to it with 2 columns (Title and Description) and 20 rows
  3. Fill the table with the Title of the issue and it’s description
  4. Highlight the first row and a JIRA macro will pop up
  5. Select Create multiple issues from table, select the project you’re created and the issue type and hit Create


Expected result
The issues are created in JIRA and added into the table in Confluence

Actual result
The issues are created in JIRA but it did not appear in the Confluence’s table

Workaround

Create issues one by one
fields.summary: Create multiple JIRA issues from a table in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Current, while editing a page "save and close" is an option that can be very misleading to some users, replacing that text on the button for "save draft" or "save
unpublished changes" would be more accurate.


!Screen Shot 2017-04-05 at 5.03.20 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Change the save and close button on Collaborative editing, while editing a page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Unable to download attachments that contain an ampersand, omega or whatever special characters in HTML in their filename (like *&*, for example).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add an attachment with filename that contains ampersand to a space
 # From the attachments page click on the filename

h3. Expected Results
 * File is downloaded

h3. Actual Results
 * 'Page Not Found' is loaded

h3. Workaround
 * Rename filename to remove ampersands
fields.summary: Unable to download attachments that contain HTML-unsafe characters in their file name
Code block with {} shows up empty when saved and viewed

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Links added using configured shortcut links on your Confluence site, is broken when you edit the page.
h3. Environment

Confluence 1000.1172.0
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure Shortcut links eg.
Key: test
Expanded Value: [https://google.com|https://google.com/]
Default Alias: %s
 # Create a new page and a link to "atlassian" text using [atlassian@test]
 # Publish the page
 # Edit the page and Publish again

h3. Expected Results
 * The link should still be working after editing the page

h3. Actual Results
 * The link will not work after editing the page.
fields.summary: Links added using configured shortcut links is broken after page edit

fields.description: The Customer asks for the ability to apply a comment to different versions any point in time. Now we can only place a comment before we save an edit to the page.
fields.summary: Ability to apply comment to different versions any point in time

fields.description:
h3. Problem
- When you copy the content of a public external page, with text and images, to a Confluence page, Confluence does not attach the images in the application, it just puts a reference to the original URL, what can lead to issues since if the original page be deleted or removed the Confluence images will be too.

h3. Suggestion
- Allow Confluence to attach images instead of just linking it.

h3. Workaround
- Copy on Word and Import through it
fields.summary: Attach images instead of copying the link

fields.description:
*Summary*

User unable to generate backup, they seeing the following error:
{code:java}
Export error
Unexpected error during export has occurred
But don't worry, we'll fix it for you!
You just need to contact Atlassian support and paste in this error message, timestamp and your instance details.{code}
fields.summary: Unable to create confluence backup

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When creating pages using templates, for some use cases, would be good if the page created with a template already come with user pre-defined labels for that specific template. Confluence already does that when using its natives templates (i.e: meeting notes). However this is still not possible for user created templates

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow to assign default labels for when a template is created, this should automatically come with pages created from that existing template.

h3. Why this is important
To ease searches, reports, avoid extra work of always having to add specific labels
fields.summary: Auto assign labels when creating from template.

*JIRA Issues Macro*

!jira_issues_macro.png!

*Page Not Found*

!page_not_found.png!

fields.description:
A managed transaction is causing the site import can fail (at around 94%) due to a bad user, even though the error may be recoverable.

As the site import is completing, the post import stack begins to run. The {{UserPostImportTask}} is attempting to set properties on users to be added to the system. If a erroneous user exists in the import, this process can throw a NullPointerException (which will cause the transaction to be set to rollback only), and the import in process to fail.

It appears the code in {{UserPostImportTask.createUserPersonalInformation}} does not expect the transaction to roll back, as the exception is swallowed and waned to the logs.

In this case we should modify {{DefaultPersonalInformationManager}} to not cause the NPE, rather than configure the transactionInterceptor to not abort on this exception.
fields.summary: Erroneous user can cause Site Import to fail without error

fields.description:
Into Confluence OnDemand Backup Manager:
- \{INSTANCE_URL}/wiki/plugins/servlet/ondemandbackupmanager/admin

Its possible check the following message:
{quote}
If Confluence Self-Hosted 5.3 is not available for download yet, you can locally install version 5.5-OD-31-009 and then restore your data. See more details about version 5.5-OD-31-009 in our [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Migrating+from+Confluence+OnDemand+to+a+Confluence+Installed+Site].
{quote}

However the *documentation* link sends to the wrong page, returning to a *Not Found* page.

The correct one is the following link:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Migrating+from+Confluence+Cloud+to+Confluence+Server
fields.summary: Wrong link into Confluence OnDemand Backup Manager

fields.description:
The Excerpt Include include macro "cannot find" pages when a page name includes a "#" symbol. The reported error is: {code} The page {insert page name here} does not exist. {code}

Steps to reproduce: 

# create a parent page that uses the "excerpt" macro
# create a child page that uses the "excerpt include" macro (point it to the parent page created in step #1)
# Test the except / excerpt include macros are working correctly. 
# Rename parent page to include a # (hash/pound) symbol
# Child page created in step #2 will now read: {code} The page {insert page name here} does not exist. {code}
fields.summary: Excerpt Include macro fails when page name includes #

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

* Add a new page, enter some text and “drag-and-drop” an excel spreadsheet:

!create_page.png!

* Saved and it shows the page creator:

!page_creator.png!

* Now, another user comes by and decides to change the excel spreadsheet, but not edit the page otherwise. Clicked “paperclip” and attached new file via drag-and-drop:

!another_user_editing.png!
!changes_made.png!

* Returned to the page. The edited excel document is rendered, but everyone thinks that someone else put in these changes earlier.

!changes_not_reflected.png!

If page-down is used - no error occur.

fields.description:
When CONF-21909 was prematurely merged to master, deployments containing that merge started down the road to OD deployment. The process was halted short of a full OD rollout, but got at least as far as DOG. The merge has since been reverted on master.

This merge introduced new indexes to 5 different Confluence tables. These new indexes will now need to be manually unpicked from each database to which the deployment was applied.
fields.summary: Remove bogus indexes created by CONF-21909
Import from another Cloud Confluence instance throws GroupNotFoundException

fields.description:
As of now, the *Blog* page of a Space displays the _Edit_ link below every blog post, regardless of the user viewing it being the author of it or not. To like or comment a post, user needs to open it first.
The links should be adjusted to the current user, allowing them to like and comment posts by others, and comment and edit their own.
fields.summary: Wrong links displayed below posts in the Space Blog page

fields.description:
Currently the info, tip, warning, note macros don't render correctly in Confluence mobile, their content just shows up as plain text, without the expected formatting.

I've seen this in 5.1-OD3, not sure if it happens in earlier versions but assuming for now it's ADG related and happens back to 5.0.
fields.summary: Info macros don't render correctly on Confluence Mobile

fields.description:
In Cloud we disallow the inclusion of arbitrary HTML/CSS/JavaScript, which customers can easily and inadvertently use to render their instance unusable.

For example, we have removed the Look & Feel 'Stylesheet' and 'Layout' options in Cloud The presence of this 'CSS Stylesheet' macro subverts this, so it should be removed.
fields.summary: Confluence Cloud should not include the 'CSS Stylesheet' macro

fields.description: jWhen trying to insert a Confluence Page Gadget into a confluence space page, the gadget messes up and trys to load the whole URL of the drop down link you've selected to be the space or page. Also for legacy page gadgets (it was working at one point) are all just not functioning anymore. The little loader bar shows up, but as soon as it's gone, there is nothing left in it's place, just an empty wrapper bucket. This is across all environments.
fields.summary: Confluence Page Gadget

fields.description:
In edit mode, the ! opens up the media suggestions window, and needs to be escaped before the user ca continue normal text editing. Though the functionality is nice, like we already have this in place with the [ and { characters, the ! is a much more frequent used character in normal text than both the [ and {

There is no option to disable this functionality without also disabling the [. Could you please either replace the ! with a much less widely used character for opening up this window, make it possible to disable [ and ! separately from each other, or require white space to be present in front of the ! before opening up the media suggestions window.
fields.summary: ! insert image macro creates inconvenient situations when the macro is not needed

fields.description:
There appears to be no confirmation button for editing the Space PDF Stylesheet. 

*Steps to reproduce:*
1. go to _Space Admin > PDF Stylesheet*;
2. edit the stylesheet and... well.

!pdf_sheet.png|thumbnail!


The screen for global settings (_Confluence Admin > PDF Stylesheet_) seems unaffected:
!global_sheet.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Save button missing for Space PDF Stylesheet

fields.description:
Confluence mentions are not working for one of the users, it's a big topic as this user in our case is a really important one. 

Could you please fix it or roll back my confluence to last stable version?
fields.summary: Confluence mentions, no user found for Confluence on demand

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1) Create a table and fill it with some text.
2) Change the text style to Heading1 or Heading2.
3) Save the page.

As result, the text will be vertically bottom-aligned (unnecessary space is added above the text in the rows).
Table headers don't seem to be affected.
Check the screenshots for more details.

Only able to reproduce this issue on Firefox
fields.summary: Vertical alignment in table rows is being bottom-aligned when using H1 or H2 text

fields.description:
There's a new link that's been added to the default Confluence site welcome message underneath the "Get started" that says "Forward or CC an email to Confluence to start sharing content." The link that it goes to (/admin/emailtoconfluence.action) results in a 404.

This isn't a very good user experience.
fields.summary: New link in Confluence welcome message in 5.0-OD-20 goes to a 404

fields.description: User is putting contact information into a table and using the Align macro - the first line is showing up in the editing view, but not on the final page or in the preview for the macro.
fields.summary: Align macro not showing first line

fields.description:
The sorting feature introduced by CONF-2493 seems to lack an option to enable sorting for "head-less" tables.

Create a headless table:
# create table e.g. by using the menu
# delete first row

=> The table is no longer sortable

Workarround to restore the abilitiy to sort content (without using source editor):
# create new table with same number of columns
# cut first row
# paste as first row of table you want to be able to order

Expected behavior:
Highlighting the first row of a table turns the cells into {{th}}-elements therby making the table orderable.
fields.summary: Making tables sortable

fields.description:
When using IE XP V8, getting to search results after the 1st page of results not possible.

User went to space, then specific page. Ran search. Got results. After clicking on Page "2" (bottom of screen), Space (left column) changed to All Spaces (see attachment, 2nd screen). Then tried to change All Spaces back to original space (while on page 2). Put him back to space search results Page 1.

Tried same scenario in Firefox and chrome with no problems (see attachment, top screen).

TESTED with Latest Release version for OnDemand.
fields.summary: IE8 Bug - Clicking on page X results does not preserve space filter

fields.description:
Spaces Details (Name, Description, etc) cannot be modified.  This is directly related to CONF-29865.  Turning off the Default Space Logo fixes the problem.

If you make any edits here and click save, you will see that nothing is updated.
fields.summary: Space Details cannot be modified

fields.description:
To reproduce the issue:
- Create a Confluence page
- Add a 2x4 table (or any other size)
- Click on *Heading Row* and after *Heading Column*
- Add some text on the first row of all columns, you can also take a look on this screenshot:
!example.png! 
- Save the page
- Export this page to PDF.

You will see on the page that the texts are still black, but on PDF the fonts are in blue.

The default font color on the page is black, however on PDF it is blue.

Workaround:

Select the texts and apply the *Black* color (or any other color you want) and it will force the use of the color you defined instead of blue.
fields.summary: Export to PDF default font color is blue instead of black

fields.description:
After seeing OOME errors semi-regularly that are caused by the thumbnail creator:
{noformat}
2014-06-25 23:01:38.897801500 	at com.sun.imageio.plugins.png.PNGImageReader.readMetadata(PNGImageReader.java:728)
2014-06-25 23:01:38.897811500 	at com.sun.imageio.plugins.png.PNGImageReader.readImage(PNGImageReader.java:1212)
2014-06-25 23:01:38.897811500 	at com.sun.imageio.plugins.png.PNGImageReader.read(PNGImageReader.java:1560)
2014-06-25 23:01:38.897812500 	at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.thumbnail.renderer.StreamRendererThumbnailGenerator$StreamingImageRenderer.scaleDown(StreamRendererThumbnailGenerator.java:82)
{noformat}

I finally managed to capture and analyze one and find what's causing the OOME (in this case).

For this, a .PNG has an IHDR.colorType of 6, but a bKGD of length 1 (instead of 6).  This is from a bug in JDK PNGImageReader class.  Generally, it appears that this class is not hardened against bad input.

One workaround suggested by [~gtanczyk] is to pass ignoreMetadata = true to setImage() in scaleDown()   (StreamRendererThumbnailGenerator.java), which in most circumstances will skip processing of the metadata blocks. I don't know what impact this will have on rendering actual thumbnails - from what I can see, the metadata isn't used at all, except for the PLTE chunk.

An alternate idea would be to create a Stream wrapper which performs validation on the input Stream, and sends scrubbed / corrected data to the PNGImageReader (or throws an exception if it's REALLY bad)

Third idea would be do all image processing internally instead of using imageio, so bugs in the image parser can be fixed.
fields.summary: Corrupt PNG files can cause instances to go OOME

fields.description:
The google document picker doesn't allow you to place your cursor in the title contains search box in either Confluence or JIRA.

To reach the document picker from JIRA you need to click 'Attach Google Docs' in any JIRA issue on an OnDemand instance with Google Apps integration.

To reach the document picker from Confluence you need to edit a page and then insert the macro 'Google Document' and then click 'select document'.
fields.summary: Google document's picker doesn't allow the user to search for documents.

fields.description:
Assuming we have 2 OnDemand JIRA+Confluence instances, lets call them A and B. If we first import JIRA (all content) from A to B then we import one space from Confluence, again from A to B, we have broken JIRA Issues macro in the space in B.

The following error is shown instead of the issues:
!JIRA_issue_macro_error.png|thumbnail!
It reads:
{panel}
JIRA Issues Macro: Unable to locate JIRA server for this macro. It may be due to Application Link configuration.
{panel}

Since JIRA in instance B has the same content in A, we would expect JIRA Issue Macro to be able to find the issues, since the JQL remains the same. 

*Steps to Reproduce*
* Have a JIRA + Confluence OnDemand (A) with projects and issues in JIRA
* Create a space in Confluence and create pages with JIRA Issue macro linking to issues in JIRA
* Have another JIRA + Confluence OnDemand (B) instance
* Full export JIRA in A and import in B
* Export the space created in A and import it in B
* JIRA Issue macros will be broken

*Workarounds*
* Edit each JIRA Issue macro individually
* Click the 'magnifying glass' to 're-search' for the issues
* Confluence will find them
* Insert again the macro and save the page
fields.summary: Importing Space After JIRA Import breaks JIRA Issues Macro

fields.description: Add a status macro to a page. Click on it while still in edit mode and the properties bar will appear. In the properties bar, edit the status text and the color at the same time. Only the text will change and not the color. I haven't figured out how to simultaneously change two properties of the status macro in the properties bar.
fields.summary: Status macros won't allow changing two properties of an existing macro

fields.description:
It turns out that some customers have pages that contain multiple contentLayout divs. Since the OnDemand upgrade from Confluence 5.2-OD-5 to 5.2-OD-13, these pages no longer behave like they used to and are missing content when rendered (either for viewing or editing). Inspecting the document storage format, the content is all still there. It might look like this, where only the content in the final contentLayout div is rendered: {code:html}
(content that is NOT rendered)
(content that is rendered)
{code} or this, where nothing on the page is rendered: {code:html}
(content is here but not rendered) {code} These duplicate contentLayout divs should be cleaned up by the editor on the fly so that the content will be displayed. OnDemand customers have no way to edit the storage format data directly on their own.
fields.summary: Pages with unexpected page layout (contentlayout) structure no longer have some content rendered

fields.description:
Creating/Editing a Confluence page and simpling writing an Issue Key of an issue on JIRA, after the page is saved, turns the Issue Key text to a link for that issue on JIRA.

If a user links to an internal system which isnt JIRA, for example CHANGE-123, then it still links to JIRA when the user saves the page and there is no way of removing this link.
fields.summary: When a user writes any string like ABC-123, Confluence automatically attempts to link to JIRA projects which dont exist utomatic links to JIRA issues on Confluence when a issue key written

fields.description: Searching for **example** should give more result than searching for *example* (without any wildcards). However it's the opposite
fields.summary: Search results with wildcards is not complete

fields.description:

We have released a fixed installer on [this page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Migrating+from+Confluence+OnDemand+to+a+Confluence+Installed+Site]. All good now, thanks to [~easenjo]!
fields.summary: 5.4-OD-20-005 seems to be broken (Cache is not alive errors during installation)

fields.description:
h4. ***Summary***
This refers to images placed in tables. The images are not resized in table cells except the header which causes a horizontal scroll bar for the table.
h4. ***Steps to reproduce the issue***
# Create a page with layout. i.e three column layout
# Create a table 
# Add an image with a large width in any table cells (not in the header)
fields.summary: Images are not automatically resized in table cells as in its header

fields.description:
Page links starting with # (anchor links) will always show as modified between page versions (Highlighted in light blue as "Formatting was changed.")

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Create a page
# write 'text'
# select it and click on Insert a Link
# go to Advanced
# insert the link: #something
# save page
# edit page by adding some random text.
# compare versions by clicking in '(view changes)'

Result: Change is highlighted in green and link is highlighted in blue although it was not changed.
Expected: Only the added text is highlighted in green.
fields.summary: Anchor links always show as modified when comparing page versions

fields.description:
If Multiple entries for a Single group are present in the {{spacepermissions}} table for Global Permissions, a request to  {{/wiki/rest/userprovisioning/1/config}} will throw a 500 error.

The UI is unaffected but this will prevent the New User Management in OnDemand from loading the Confluence license count, instead it shows the folowing error:

*Confluence (Error communicating with Confluence: Internal Server Error)*

Going to the rest url directly shows the following
{noformat}
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: duplicate key: administrators-confluence at 
com.google.common.base.Preconditions.checkArgument(Preconditions.java:115) at com.google.common.collect.RegularImmutableMap.<init>(RegularImmutableMap.java:72) at 
com.google.common.collect.ImmutableMap$Builder.fromEntryList(ImmutableMap.java:221) at 
com.google.common.collect.ImmutableMap$Builder.build(ImmutableMap.java:207) at 
com.google.common.collect.Maps.uniqueIndex(Maps.java:571) at 
com.google.common.collect.Maps.uniqueIndex(Maps.java:527) at 
com.atlassian.crowd.plugin.usermanagement.userprovisioning.UserProvisioningController$1.apply(UserProvisioningController.java:32) at 
com.atlassian.crowd.plugin.usermanagement.userprovisioning.UserProvisioningController$1.apply(UserProvisioningController.java:28) at 
com.atlassian.crowd.plugin.usermanagement.userprovisioning.UserProvisioningController.toMap(UserProvisioningController.java:71) at 
com.atlassian.crowd.plugin.usermanagement.userprovisioning.UserProvisioningController.getConfiguration(UserProvisioningController.java:55) at 
com.atlassian.crowd.plugin.usermanagement.userprovisioning.UserProvisioningResource.getConfiguration(UserProvisioningResource.java:41) at 
sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor12894.invoke(Unknown Source) at 
sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597) at  

{noformat}

*Workaround/Fix*
To fix this in an affected instance perform the following steps:

the error message shows the following: _duplicate key: administrators-confluence_ so administrators-confluence group needs to be cleaned up
# Go to Global permissions in Confluence.
# Edit Permissions
# uncheck all permissions from the affected group (administrators-confluence in this example)
# Save the permissions
** The Group will NOT be removed, instead it will remain in place with an option ticked that you removed
# Keep repeating step 3-4 until the Group no longer is shown on the Global Permissions page.
# Re-add the group.

The error will be cleared up and the OD user management page will work once more.
fields.summary: /wiki/rest/userprovisioning/1/config throws 500 error when multiple entries are in Global Permissions

fields.description:
Hi,

I am using Confluence OnDemand. I have sucessfully created a backup (21mb) and am now trying to download it. This is what happens:

1. When I click on the file a dialog pops up titled Authentication Required. 
2. It asks for my username/pw. (See Attachment)
3. I enter in my regular u/pw - the dialog pops back up. This happens in a continuous loop. So I tried the admin password. Same thing happens.
4. If I cancel out of the dialog I get the second error attached.
fields.summary: Confluence OnDemand Download Back-up WebDav Error

fields.description:
When re-ordering pages in Confluence, if a user drops the page below the tree area when trying to add it to the end of the hierarchy, the tree structure is not refreshed and duplicated pages appear on the screen. Please see the image below:
!reordering.png!

It is happening on both Chrome 37 and Safari 7.0.6.
fields.summary: Reorder pages shows duplicated pages when they are dropped outside the tree frame

fields.description:
I have a confluence dashboard created and using user status list macro. This seems to be broken in last 2~3 weeks.

Steps:
1. Create a confluence page
2. Edit and insert user list status macro
3. Update it for an user with status update exists for some day (or does not exists for last couple of days)
4. refresh the preview or save the page
5. Result as in attached screenshot.
fields.summary: ‘User Status List’ Macro returning "Unable to render content due to system error: null "

fields.description:
Example (original PDF attached): https://kognito.atlassian.net/wiki/display/AA/Character+Creation+Overview

The PDF viewer seems to be stretching the text and background, while rendering images correctly.
fields.summary: PDF macro displaying PDFs incorrectly

fields.description: The documentation still mentions the "add task'" button: [Managing Notifications in Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Managing+Notifications+in+Confluence]. The button isn't there anymore though, and the whole Tasks section was moved to user profile.
fields.summary: Adding the notification to task list unavailable after Tasks were moved out of Workbox

fields.description:
h3. Issue
----
In Confluence (found with OnDemand) if you insert the JIRA issue macro by typing in:

{code}
{jira:TPO-2}
{code}

...with TPO-2 being the issue key, the displayed macro is broken. It appears to have an '=' sign inserted in, making it render incorrectly. 

This behavior is also duplicatable by selecting WIKI MARKUP then typing in the string.

However, if you use the INSERT - JIRA ISSUES MACRO button, the display behavior is normal. See screenshot. I was able to reproduce this on toolbox.atlassian.net and a customers instance.

h3. Workaround
----
Use the INSERT - JIRA ISSUES MACRO button in Confluence. Alternatively, if you select the broken macro image, select EDIT then save it, it removes the '=' and renders correctly.
fields.summary: JIRA Issue Macro broken

fields.description:
Steps to replicate:

# Create a page titled 'test of # in the page title' make the body the word 'test'.
# Create another page
# Insert the 'include' macro
# Find the page created in step 1
# Save page

Result:

The following error is shown:

{noformat}
Unable to render {include} The included page could not be found.
{noformat}

Expected Result:

The include macro loads correctly.
fields.summary: Include macro does not render page with '#' in the table

fields.description:
The link to this service is visible to administrators but it is not accessible as dministrators will received 403 Forbidden.

This is confusing as it is either being shown wrongly or there's a real issue in giving the access. 

https://<domain_name>/wiki/plugins/servlet/pas/admin
fields.summary: Confluence Public Announcement Service availability is confusing to administrators

fields.description: For the first few seconds, during loading of a page, if a user clicks the search field, it is immediately deselected.
fields.summary: Search field gets deselected during loading
Widget connector macro feed Twitter information doesn't render

fields.description:
OnDemand: 5.1-OD-4

Trying to save an existing document in Confluence 5.1

The following error(s) occurred:
The editor content could not be parsed. There is a problem at line 1, column 32804. Parser message: Unexpected close tag </ac:rich-text-body>; expected </img>. at [row,col {unknown-source}]: [1,32804]
fields.summary: "The editor content could not be parsed" message when saving an existing page

fields.description:
When inserting JIRA Display Macro into Confluence Page, Display Options is now showing as completely expanded.

Used to be manually expanded but now it is doing it on its own.

!Screenshot 2014-10-19 12.16.49.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: JIRA Issues Macro Automatically Expanding to Display Options

fields.description:
When trying to download an attachment from Confluence where its extension is *.vm you get a "403 Forbidden" message.

As a workaround for downloading it you can rename the file to *.txt.
fields.summary: Unable do download *.vm attachments from Confluence

fields.description:
Impossible to upload and restore the XML from Confluence on Demand into the 3.2 standalone version, build number 4394. Could you please advise on that, as this issue is critical for us.

Error message: "Import failed. Check your server logs for more information. com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.ImportExportException: Unable to complete import: Error while importing backup: could not insert: [com.atlassian.confluence.setup.bandana.ConfluenceBandanaRecord#19595280]"
fields.summary: Import failure

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce
# Go to Confluence Admin >> Global Templates
# Edit Default Welcome Message, and add a Jira Issues macro listing more than one issue (eg: status = Open) or a markup with:
{noformat}
{jira:anonymous=true|url=http://jira.atlassian.com/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-xml/temp/SearchRequest.xml?jqlQuery=project+%3D+CONF+AND+%28summary+%7E+jiraissues+OR+description+%7E+jiraissues+OR+comment+%7E+jiraissues%29&tempMax=10|columns=type;key;summary}
{noformat}
# Preview will show the issues correctly.
# Save
# Go to the Welcome Page: the macro will not be rendered, instead shows this error:
{quote}
java.lang.NullPointerException
{quote}
# No error is reported on the logs (Jira or Confluence).

h5. Workaround
# Create a new page. For example, titled "_Welcome" on a space with spacekey DS.
# Add the jiraissues macro in that page and save it
# Edit the Default Welcome Message and add a Include Page macro pointing to "DS:_Welcome"
# JIRA issues macro now should be rendered fine in the Dashboard Welcome page.

h5. Testing Notes
Follow the Steps to reproduce above, you can add more than 1 JIM markups to the Welcome page, the test will be passed if:
# No NPEs shown
# Refresh links work properly (only a JIM table is refreshed at one time)
# Table sorting works properly
fields.summary: Jira Issues macro displays java.lang.NullPointerException when included on Welcome Message

fields.description: The normal "Edit in Office" link for an attachment is not viewable today (when logged in).
fields.summary: Presentation of "Edit in Office" Functionality for a JIRA attachment is not viewable today.

fields.description: UserPreferencesResource exposes all data stored in a UserPreferences object, and allows updating it via a POST. This vulnerability needs to be closed before the next deployment.
fields.summary: UserPreferencesResource accepts form encoded data, is vulnerable to XSRF attacks

fields.description:
I applied a page layout with top and bottom full width horizontal sections, with a three column section sandwiched between the two.

I insert the same 400x100 in the columns, however when published the layout is not rendering the columns evenly.

See the attached screenshot. In this example, the 1st column resizes the image to ~388px wide. However, the 2nd and 3rd columns render the same image to ~369px wide. This example was created in OnDemand.
fields.summary: Three column page layout - 1st column is wider than 2nd and 3rd

fields.description:
***Summary***
Newly created spreadsheet in Google cannot be displayed using the Google Spreadsheet macro. Error thrown as below
{code}
java.lang.RuntimeException: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Trying to set foreign cookie
    at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getInputStream(HttpURLConnection.java:1137)
caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Trying to set foreign cookie
    at com.google.gdata.client.http.GoogleGDataRequest$GoogleCookie.<init>(GoogleGDataRequest.java:166)
{code}

***Steps to reproduce***
# Create a new spreadsheet in Google Drive (Spreadsheet X)
# Login to OnDemand instance, <hostname>.atlassian.net with Google SSO
# Go to Confluence
# Create Page
# Insert *Google Spreadsheet macro*
# Choose file, spreadsheet X
# Observe that the error will be displayed in the preview
# Save

***Expected Behaviour***
The spreadsheet is display in the Confluence page

***Current Behaviour***
!error.png!
fields.summary: New Google Spreadsheets cannot be displayed using Google Spreadsheet Macro in Confluence
Documentation Link in div macro gives page not found

fields.description:
Having the same scrollbar issue as in [CONF-31185|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-31185].  But besides having the scrollbar at the bottom, it's also doing something weird with the share button, which is a new issue.

h4.To Replicate (with Spanish set as your user language)
# Click *Compartir* on a page.
# Start typing in the name of the user with whom you'd like to share, select the user when it comes up.
# The moment you click the user, before you can click the 2nd *Compartir* button, the pop up disappears.
# The original *Compartir* is pressed in/greyed out.  If you click somewhere else on the page, the button un-clicks itself and the extra scrollbar disappears.

h4.Workaround
Click *Compartir* again, and the user you had selected is there still, and you can click *Compartir* to share.
fields.summary: Share button greyed out when using Spanish locale

fields.description:
*Problem*
It is not possible to upload profile picture to Confluence if the file has more than 1.5MB

*Steps to reproduce*
1 - log into Confluence
2 - click on your avatar (top right corner) and select ‘Profile’
3 - click on ‘Profile > Picture’ on the left panel
4 - click on ‘Choose File’ and select an image with more than 1.5MB
5 - click on ‘Upload’. The message below will be displayed
!upload_image.png!

The documentation doesn’t state any size limitation - [Choosing a Profile Picture|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Choosing+a+Profile+Picture].

Thanks!
fields.summary: Error when trying to upload a profile picture with more than 1.5 MB

fields.description:
As reported by [~bob.swift@charter.net], getServerInfo is not returning the right Confluence for OD version any longer. 

The service gets the version as a combination of: info.getMajorVersion() + "." + info.getMinorVersion() + "." + info.getPatchLevel(). 

This stopped working correctly a while ago with OnDemand, when the version format changed. It is annoying as it forces customers to look at the build number instead.

{noformat}
/sde/atlassian-cli-3.8.0/atlassian confluence-onDemandDevelopment --action getServerInfo
Confluence version: 5.4.0, build: 4989, url: https://bobswift-test.jira-dev.com/wiki
{noformat}
fields.summary: getServerInfo() service method does not return a right Confluence version for OD version

fields.description:
Go to Create > Balsamiq in IE11.  

Editor never loads. 

Saw in PUG and in blitz instance
fields.summary: Balsamiq blueprint is blank in IE11

fields.description:
When clicking on an unknown attachment, it renders the unknown attachment image in the image preview. It's considered a single image in the image preview.

https://jsoderstrom7.jira-dev.com/wiki/display/~raymond/jhkjh
fields.summary: Unknown attachments when loading a page with many attachments

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce: 

1. Create new Confluence page
2. Insert "Code Block" macro (however this bug appears to affect all)
3. Type something (such as 'test') into the code macro's "Title" text input box.
4. Select "Insert" to place the macro into your page
5. Click button to "Preview >"
6. Return to editing by clicking "< Edit"
7. Click the macro's title border and select "Edit" from the menu
8. Click the text entry box for the "Title" 

Current behavior: When attempting to change the text or create new text, cursor appears in the text entry box, however keyboard input does not appear to work into the field. (unable to re-edit).

Expected behavior: The user must be able to edit and change, after coming back to Edit this macro, without going to the main page(workaround).

This problem happens in Chrome 18, Firefox and IE9.
fields.summary: Unable to edit text fields in macro editor after a page preview

fields.description:
After upgrading to v 5.2.3 entries with tables as the first item on a page will not show the first table. Putting a carriage return before the table will allow it to be viewable. i.e. this shows all the text from the WYSIWYG editor:

 

 

This

 Is a Table
It's Not The First
Item On The
Page    

There is more text here

 

This does not show the table:

This

 Is a Table
It's The First
Item On The
Page    

There is more text here
fields.summary: Table not viewable if it's the first entry on a page

fields.description: The *In-app Notifications* option in Confluence Admin is not visible to users without the _confluence-administrators_ group membership. The workbox settings aren't listed on the [AOD Restricted Functions list|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Restricted+Functions+in+Atlassian+OnDemand], so we should either add them to it, or enable the feature.
fields.summary: In-app Notifications in Confluence Admin are not visible to users
Backup Manager not working in OnDemand

fields.description:
On the latest release of Confluence OnDemand, space names are not being rendered correctly in the Spaces menu, as you can see in the following screenshots:

!old_version.png!

!new_version.png!

In the pages, the name is displayed correctly.
fields.summary: Space names with special characters not being displayed properly

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a new spreadsheet in Google Sheets.
# Using a Cloud instance that's hooked into that same Google domain for user management, attempt to insert that new spreadsheet using the Google Spreadsheet macro.
# You get a system error in the Preview window, and this stack trace in the logs:

{code:none}
2014-12-24 09:54:17,224 ERROR [TP-Processor45] [[Catalina].[localhost].[/wiki].[servlet-module-container-servlet]] log Servlet.service() for servlet servlet-module-container-servlet threw exception
java.lang.RuntimeException: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Trying to set foreign cookie
      at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getInputStream(HttpURLConnection.java:1137)
      at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getHeaderField(HttpURLConnection.java:2346)
      at java.net.HttpURLConnection.getResponseCode(HttpURLConnection.java:388)

      at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:717)
      at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.ServletModuleContainerServlet.service(ServletModuleContainerServlet.java:52)

      at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.doFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:206)
      at com.atlassian.confluence.web.filter.DebugFilter.doFilter(DebugFilter.java:50)
      at com.atlassian.core.filters.AbstractHttpFilter.doFilter(AbstractHttpFilter.java:31)
      at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:235)
      at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.doFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:206)

      at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.filter.DelegatingPluginFilter$1.doFilter(DelegatingPluginFilter.java:70)
      at com.atlassian.labs.botkiller.BotKillerFilter.doFilter(BotKillerFilter.java:36)
      at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.filter.DelegatingPluginFilter.doFilter(DelegatingPluginFilter.java:78)
[...]
Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Trying to set foreign cookie
      at com.google.gdata.client.http.GoogleGDataRequest$GoogleCookie.<init>(GoogleGDataRequest.java:166)
      at com.google.gdata.client.http.GoogleGDataRequest$GoogleCookieHandler.put(GoogleGDataRequest.java:399)
      at sun.net.www.http.HttpClient.parseHTTPHeader(HttpClient.java:710)
      at sun.net.www.http.HttpClient.parseHTTP(HttpClient.java:632)
      at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getInputStream(HttpURLConnection.java:1195)
      at java.net.HttpURLConnection.getResponseCode(HttpURLConnection.java:379)
      ... 253 more
{code}

Older documents actually work fine, but newly-created documents all fail. I haven't been able to determine the exact cut-off. This does _not_ occur for Docs or Presentations, only Sheets.


*EDIT 21/04/2015* We rolled out new set of macros for google drive integration. More details onto:
- Confluence Server - https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOCM/Google+Drive+macros
- Confluence Cloud - https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ConfCloud/Google+Drive+macros

Unfortunately we weren't able to do automatic migration from old macros to new macros. This needs to be done manually.
fields.summary: New Google Sheets unable to be inserted into Confluence with Google Spreadsheets macro

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

* Create a filter in JIRA
* Create a page in Confluence and add the JIRA issues macro
* Under the search parameter, add the filter ID. Example: filter=10100
* Perform the search and on the bottom select Display Options
* Remove the Key column and add it again, as the last column
!columns.png!
* Save the changes to the page
* The Key column will be shown as the first one 
!display.png!
fields.summary: JIRA issues gadget columns reorder after saving

fields.description:
It looks as though there is no "What's New" update in Confluence 5.2-OD-3 informing customers of the changes & updates.  Instead they get "Stay Tuned!  The next version of Confluence is coming soon..."

The official release notes are not updated completely either or visible to customers - https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+5.2+Release+Notes.
fields.summary: No What's New update in Confluence 5.2

fields.description: When user click on preview button of blog post comment, background area in footer is changing and
fields.summary: Click Preview on blog post comment makes background broken

fields.description:
After adding the Watched Issues macro the watchers column is added by default, and not removable.  Adding watchers column is an option and does not duplicate columns but removing the column after adding it it still remains.

h3.Steps to reproduce
# Add the watched issues Gadget to any JIRA dashboard.
# Click Edit

h3.Expected
Ability to remove watchers column

h3.Actual 
Watchers column is not a removable column.
fields.summary: Cannot remove watchers column from watched issues gadget

fields.description:
Reproduction steps:

1. Take a PDF file and name it 'elephant.pdf'
2. Attach 'elephant.pdf' to a page
3. Go to the site search page
4. Search for 'elephant'. Observe that the pdf is not found.
5. Search for 'pdf'. Observe that the pdf is not found.
6. Search for 'elephant.pdf'. Observe that now the pdf is found.

Workaround:
Search for 'filename: elephant' or 'filename: pdf' instead.

Cause:
The filename field uses a special analyser: ConfluenceFilenameAnalyzer that tokenises filenames nicely. However by default the filename field is *not* used in searches. Instead we use the title field. It seems like the analyser used for the title field does not tokenises filenames nicely, hence the poor search results for attachments.
fields.summary: [Backend] Search results for the title of an attachment are poor

fields.description: "Likes" are not imported when running a space import. Further investigation shows that the LikeEntities are added to the database but still point to the "old" contentId. This is impacting the Entreprise Hosted Confluence Migrator (see [CIM-30|https://sdog.jira.com/browse/CIM-30])
fields.summary: Likes are not imported when doing a Space export/import

fields.description:
1. Confluence standalone instance - shows the the old OnDemand favicon (I think?):
!Screen Shot 2013-09-06 at 10.50.15 AM.png!

2. On a Conf+JIRA instance, I don't see any favicon for Confluence:
!Screen Shot 2013-09-06 at 10.50.01 AM.png!

3. Same on SDOG
!Screen Shot 2013-09-06 at 10.49.42 AM.png!

4. BTF seems ok
!Screen Shot 2013-09-06 at 10.49.31 AM.png!
fields.summary: Confluence favicon not shown, or incorrect one shown for OnDemand

fields.description:
Using the stock browser on cyanogenmod 11 (not chrome) the expand macro doesn't do anything when you click on it.  My co-worker experiences the same problem on IOS.  This renders some pages completely unusable on mobile devices.

Experiencing this on an OnDemand instance.
fields.summary: Expand Macro doesn't expand on mobile browsers

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

- Insert an IM Macro.
- Type in your Skype name, and save the page.
- The IM render will show offline.

The IM macro will always show you as offline and will not even send an invitation to your Skype user.

*Workaround:*
Review your Skype client 'Preferences'.
The 'Privacy' tab will have an option to 'Show my status on the web'.  Ensure this is checked and refresh the page containing the macro.
fields.summary: Skype IM presence does not show status on page

fields.description:
The menu option 'License Details' is no longer available for Confluence Administrators and in confluence-only instances, that don't have the new User Management enabled, there is no way of counting the licenses granted and how many are available.

Affecting Version 5.5-OD-22-001

*Workaround:*
a) To see how many users are Enabled, count the users in the 'users' group that aren't disabled.
b) If you have a rather large instance, open a support request at http://support.atlassian.com (pointing to this bug) and the OnDemand Support team will provide the result for:
{code}select count(*) as Active from cwd_user where active = 'T';{code}
fields.summary: Confluence License Details not available on OnDemand
